alert.note: Alert for Bear Lake and Bear River Valley; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 7:26AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Rich County through 800 AM MDT... At 725 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bear Lake, or near Laketown, moving north at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Laketown, Bear Lake Idaho Portion, Garden City, Bear Lake, Garden, Meadowville, Pickelville and Lakota. This storm will be capable of producing strong gusty winds on Bear Lake. This will lead to a sudden increase in waves and very choppy waters which will result in hazardous boating conditions. Boaters are urged to seek safe harbor if possible. This includes the following highways... US Route 89 between mile markers 497 and 502. Utah Route 30 between mile markers 110 and 118. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Bear Lake, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.

area.areaDesc: Bear Lake and Bear River Valley; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North
